Items.Title: Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution supporting President Barack Obama’s nomination of Judge Sonia Sotomayor to the Supreme Court of the United States, congratulating Judge Sotomayor on her nomination, and urging swift Senate confirmation.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Urging President Obama to appoint Sonia Sotomayor, a judge on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, to the Supreme Court of the United States.

Items.MinutesNote:
Editor's Note:  This Stated Meeting of June 10, 2009 continued into the the Recessed Meeting of June 10, 2009 held on June 15, 2009.   Consistent within the guidelines of a recessed meeting, Council Members who were present on June 15, 2009, but were not present on June 10, 2009, are given the opportunity to vote on the items that were listed on the Stated Council Meeting Agenda of June 10, 2009.

Council Members Mendez and Vann were not present on June 10, 2009 when this Stated Council Meeting of June 10, 2009 first opened.  Both of these Council Members, however, were present for this Recessed Meeting of June 10, 2009 held on June 15, 2009.     

-see Editor's Note after General Order vote for further explanation.

Also: for Attendance Records purposes, a Council Member is considered "present" for the Stated Council Meeting of June 10, 2009 if that Council Member attended any of the meetings that constitute this particular Stated Council Meeting , i.e., the Stated Council Meeting held on June 10, 2009, the Recessed Meeting of June 10, 2009 held on June 15, 2009, and any subsequent Recessed Meetings of June 10, 2009 held on subsequent dates.

Editor's Note:  This Stated Meeting of June 10, 2009 continued into the Recessed Meeting of June 10, 2009 held on June 15, 2009.   Consistent within the guidelines of a recessed meeting, Council Members who were present on June 15, 2009, but were not present on June 10, 2009, are given the opportunity to vote on the items that were listed on the Stated Council Meeting Agenda of June 10, 2009.

Council Members Mendez and Vann were not present on June 10, 2009 when the Stated Council Meeting of June 10, 2009 first opened.  Both these Council Members, however, were present for this Recessed Meeting of June 10, 2009 held on June 15, 2009.     

At this point, consistent within the guidelines of a recessed meeting, Council Members Mendez and Vann were allowed to cast a vote on the items from the June 10, 2009 Stated Council Meeting agenda:

Council Member Mendez voted affirmative on the Land Use Call-Up and the items coupled on General Orders except for the following in which she voted negative:
LU 1073 & Res 2018, LU 1074 & Res 2019, LU 1075 & Res 2020 

Council Member Vann voted affirmative on the LU call-up and the items coupled on General Orders.

The revised LU call-up vote for the June 10, 2009 Agenda call-up is 51-0-0;

The revised vote for the General Order vote from the June 10, 2009 Agenda is
51-0-0 with the following exceptions:

LU 1073 & Res 2018,    41-10-0
LU 1074 & Res 2019,    41-10-0
LU 1075 & Res 2020,    41-10-0
LU 1082 & Res 2021,     50-1-0
LU 1113 & Res 2029      50-1-0
